parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code of the substance or ingredient

parameters.name: expiry
parameters.description: Expiry date of package or container of substance

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: Amount of substance in the package

info.description: A homogeneous material with a definite composition
info.title: FHIR R4 Substance Resource

confidentiality.description: Confidentiality level of the specified substance as the ingredient

group.description: The group of specified substance, e.g. group 1 to 4

strength.description: Quantity of the substance or specified substance present in the manufactured item or pharmaceutical product

concentration.description: The strength per unitary volume (or mass)

concentrationLowLimit.description: A lower limit for the strength per unitary volume (or mass), for when there is a range. The concentration attribute then becomes the upper limit

country.description: The country or countries for which the strength range applies

measurementPoint.description: For when strength is measured at a particular point or distance

presentation.description: The quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item

presentationLowLimit.description: A lower limit for the quantity of substance in the unit of presentation. For use when there is a range of strengths, this is the lower limit, with the presentation attribute becoming the upper limit

referenceStrength.description: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance

country.description: The country or countries for which the strength range applies

measurementPoint.description: For when strength is measured at a particular point or distance

strength.description: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance

strengthLowLimit.description: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance

Substance.description: A homogeneous material with a definite composition

category.description: What class/type of substance this is

code.description: A code (or set of codes) that identify this substance.

description.description: A description of the substance - its appearance, handling requirements, and other usage notes.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

status.description: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

expiry.description: When no longer valid to use

quantity.description: Amount of substance in the package

amount[x].description: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field

amountText.description: A textual comment on a numeric value.

amountType.description: Most elements that require a quantitative value will also have a field called amount type. Amount type should always be specified because the actual value of the amount is often dependent on it. EXAMPLE: In capturing the actual relative amounts of substances or molecular fragments it is essential to indicate whether the amount refers to a mole ratio or weight ratio. For any given element an effort should be made to use same the amount type for all related definitional elements

SubstanceNucleicAcid.description: Nucleic acids are defined by three distinct elements: the base, sugar and linkage. Individual substance/moiety IDs will be created for each of these elements. The nucleotide sequence will be always entered in the 5’-3’ direction

areaOfHybridisation.description: The area of hybridisation shall be described if applicable for double stranded RNA or DNA. The number associated with the subunit followed by the number associated to the residue shall be specified in increasing order. The underscore “” shall be used as separator as follows: “Subunitnumber Residue”

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

numberOfSubunits.description: The number of linear sequences of nucleotides linked through phosphodiester bonds shall be described. Subunits would be strands of nucleic acids that are tightly associated typically through Watson-Crick base pairing. NOTE: If not specified in the reference source, the assumption is that there is 1 subunit

sequenceType.description: The type of the sequence shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

fivePrime.description: The nucleotide present at the 5’ terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5’ prime nucleotide is the letter at the first position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant

length.description: The length of the sequence shall be captured

linkage.description: The linkages between sugar residues will also be captured

sequence.description: Actual nucleotide sequence notation from 5' to 3' end using standard single letter codes. In addition to the base sequence, sugar and type of phosphate or non-phosphate linkage should also be captured

subunit.description: Index of linear sequences of nucleic acids in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts

threePrime.description: The nucleotide present at the 3’ terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5’ prime nucleotide is the letter at the last position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant

connectivity.description: The entity that links the sugar residues together should also be captured for nearly all naturally occurring nucleic acid the linkage is a phosphate group. For many synthetic oligonucleotides phosphorothioate linkages are often seen. Linkage connectivity is assumed to be 3’-5’. If the linkage is either 3’-3’ or 5’-5’ this should be specified

identifier.description: Each linkage will be registered as a fragment and have an ID

name.description: Each linkage will be registered as a fragment and have at least one name. A single name shall be assigned to each linkage

residueSite.description: Residues shall be captured as described in 5.3.6.8.3

identifier.description: The Substance ID of the sugar or sugar-like component that make up the nucleotide

name.description: The name of the sugar or sugar-like component that make up the nucleotide

residueSite.description: The residues that contain a given sugar will be captured. The order of given residues will be captured in the 5‘-3‘direction consistent with the base sequences listed above

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

SubstanceProtein.description: A SubstanceProtein is defined as a single unit of a linear amino acid sequence, or a combination of subunits that are either covalently linked or have a defined invariant stoichiometric relationship. This includes all synthetic, recombinant and purified SubstanceProteins of defined sequence, whether the use is therapeutic or prophylactic. This set of elements will be used to describe albumins, coagulation factors, cytokines, growth factors, peptide/SubstanceProtein hormones, enzymes, toxins, toxoids, recombinant vaccines, and immunomodulators

disulfideLinkage.description: The disulphide bond between two cysteine residues either on the same subunit or on two different subunits shall be described. The position of the disulfide bonds in the SubstanceProtein shall be listed in increasing order of subunit number and position within subunit followed by the abbreviation of the amino acids involved. The disulfide linkage positions shall actually contain the amino acid Cysteine at the respective positions

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

numberOfSubunits.description: Number of linear sequences of amino acids linked through peptide bonds. The number of subunits constituting the SubstanceProtein shall be described. It is possible that the number of subunits can be variable

sequenceType.description: The SubstanceProtein descriptive elements will only be used when a complete or partial amino acid sequence is available or derivable from a nucleic acid sequence

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

cTerminalModification.description: The modification at the C-terminal shall be specified

cTerminalModificationId.description: Unique identifier for molecular fragment modification based on the ISO 11238 Substance ID

length.description: Length of linear sequences of amino acids contained in the subunit

nTerminalModification.description: The name of the fragment modified at the N-terminal of the SubstanceProtein shall be specified

nTerminalModificationId.description: Unique identifier for molecular fragment modification based on the ISO 11238 Substance ID

sequence.description: The sequence information shall be provided enumerating the amino acids from N- to C-terminal end using standard single-letter amino acid codes. Uppercase shall be used for L-amino acids and lowercase for D-amino acids. Transcribed SubstanceProteins will always be described using the translated sequence; for synthetic peptide containing amino acids that are not represented with a single letter code an X should be used within the sequence. The modified amino acids will be distinguished by their position in the sequence

sequenceAttachment.description: The sequence information shall be provided enumerating the amino acids from N- to C-terminal end using standard single-letter amino acid codes. Uppercase shall be used for L-amino acids and lowercase for D-amino acids. Transcribed SubstanceProteins will always be described using the translated sequence; for synthetic peptide containing amino acids that are not represented with a single letter code an X should be used within the sequence. The modified amino acids will be distinguished by their position in the sequence

subunit.description: Index of primary sequences of amino acids linked through peptide bonds in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

SubstanceSourceMaterial.description: Source material shall capture information on the taxonomic and anatomical origins as well as the fraction of a material that can result in or can be modified to form a substance. This set of data elements shall be used to define polymer substances isolated from biological matrices. Taxonomic and anatomical origins shall be described using a controlled vocabulary as required. This information is captured for naturally derived polymers ( . starch) and structurally diverse substances. For Organisms belonging to the Kingdom Plantae the Substance level defines the fresh material of a single species or infraspecies, the Herbal Drug and the Herbal preparation. For Herbal preparations, the fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level and additional information for herbal extracts will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. See for further explanation the Substance Class: Structurally Diverse and the herbal annex

countryOfOrigin.description: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For “Plasma-derived substances” the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate

developmentStage.description: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum)

geographicalLocation.description: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

organismId.description: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified.

organismName.description: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy.

parentSubstanceId.description: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant)

parentSubstanceName.description: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation.

sourceMaterialClass.description: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material.

sourceMaterialState.description: The state of the source material when extracted.

sourceMaterialType.description: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

fraction.description: This element is capturing information about the fraction of a plant part, or human plasma for fractionation

materialType.description: The specific type of the material constituting the component. For Herbal preparations the particulars of the extracts (liquid/dry) is described in Specified Substance Group 1

family.description: The family of an organism shall be specified

genus.description: The genus of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name; it is present in names for genera, species and infraspecies

intraspecificDescription.description: The intraspecific description of an organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For Influenza Vaccine, the intraspecific description shall contain the syntax of the antigen in line with the WHO convention

intraspecificType.description: The Intraspecific type of an organism shall be specified

species.description: The species of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal; it is present in names for species and infraspecies

authorDescription.description: The author of an organism species shall be specified. The author year of an organism shall also be specified when applicable; refers to the year in which the first author(s) published the infraspecific plant/animal name (of any rank)

authorType.description: The type of author of an organism species shall be specified. The parenthetical author of an organism species refers to the first author who published the plant/animal name (of any rank). The primary author of an organism species refers to the first author(s), who validly published the plant/animal name

hybridType.description: The hybrid type of an organism shall be specified

maternalOrganismId.description: The identifier of the maternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For plants, the parents aren’t always known, and it is unlikely that it will be known which is maternal and which is paternal

maternalOrganismName.description: The name of the maternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified. For plants, the parents aren’t always known, and it is unlikely that it will be known which is maternal and which is paternal

paternalOrganismId.description: The identifier of the paternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary

paternalOrganismName.description: The name of the paternal species constituting the hybrid organism shall be specified

class.description: The class of an organism shall be specified

kingdom.description: The kingdom of an organism shall be specified

order.description: The order of an organism shall be specified,

phylum.description: The phylum of an organism shall be specified

part.description: Entity of anatomical origin of source material within an organism

partLocation.description: The detailed anatomic location when the part can be extracted from different anatomical locations of the organism. Multiple alternative locations may apply

SubstanceSpecification.description: The detailed description of a substance, typically at a level beyond what is used for prescribing

comment.description: Textual comment about this record of a substance.

domain.description: If the substance applies to only human or veterinary use.

identifier.description: Identifier by which this substance is known.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

nucleicAcid.description: Data items specific to nucleic acids.

sourceMaterial.description: Material or taxonomic/anatomical source for the substance.

status.description: Status of substance within the catalogue e.g. approved.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

type.description: High level categorization, e.g. polymer or nucleic acid.

comment.description: Any comment can be provided in this field, if necessary

statusDate.description: The date at which the code status is changed as part of the terminology maintenance

identifier.description: Identifier by which this moiety substance is known

name.description: Textual name for this moiety substance

role.description: Role that the moiety is playing

domain.description: The use context of this name for example if there is a different name a drug active ingredient as opposed to a food colour additive

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction where this name applies

official.description: Details of the official nature of this name

preferred.description: If this is the preferred name for this substance

authority.description: Which authority uses this official name

status.description: The status of the official name

category.description: A category for this property, e.g. Physical, Chemical, Enzymatic

code.description: Property type e.g. viscosity, pH, isoelectric point

definingSubstance[x].description: A substance upon which a defining property depends (e.g. for solubility: in water, in alcohol)

parameters.description: Parameters that were used in the measurement of a property (e.g. for viscosity: measured at 20C with a pH of 7.1)

amount[x].description: A numeric factor for the relationship, for instance to express that the salt of a substance has some percentage of the active substance in relation to some other

amountType.description: An operator for the amount, for example "average", "approximately", "less than"

isDefining.description: For example where an enzyme strongly bonds with a particular substance, this is a defining relationship for that enzyme, out of several possible substance relationships

relationship.description: For example "salt to parent", "active moiety", "starting material"

substance[x].description: A pointer to another substance, as a resource or just a representational code

isotope.description: Applicable for single substances that contain a radionuclide or a non-natural isotopic ratio

molecularFormulaByMoiety.description: Specified per moiety according to the Hill system, i.e. first C, then H, then alphabetical, each moiety separated by a dot

molecularWeight.description: The molecular weight or weight range (for proteins, polymers or nucleic acids)

halfLife.description: Half life - for a non-natural nuclide

identifier.description: Substance identifier for each non-natural or radioisotope

molecularWeight.description: The molecular weight or weight range (for proteins, polymers or nucleic acids)

name.description: Substance name for each non-natural or radioisotope

substitution.description: The type of isotopic substitution present in a single substance

amount.description: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field

method.description: The method by which the molecular weight was determined

type.description: Type of molecular weight such as exact, average (also known as. number average), weight average

attachment.description: An attached file with the structural representation

representation.description: The structural representation as text string in a format e.g. InChI, SMILES, MOLFILE, CDX

type.description: The type of structure (e.g. Full, Partial, Representative)

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

url.description: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

lastUpdated.description: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.

profile.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

security.description: Security Labels applied to this resource

source.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

div.description: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

code.description: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

system.description: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

unit.description: A human-readable form of the unit.
